2021 UPDATE: All classes are expected to be conducted online after the first week of classes. Google Classroom will be used for some course information and assignment submissions, and, also for any outside of class contact with the teacher. This course is centered mainly on discussions based on the class topics. This is NOT a lecture style course, it requires interactive English only discussions with classmates every lesson.
<Information for students permitted to take classes online>
Sessions 2 and onwards will be held simultaneously via Zoom (meeting code will be posted on the Google Classroom site). Session 1 will be face-to-face. Lesson details will be updated on the Google Classroom site by 5:30 pm the day before our class time (Tuesdays). Email the teacher at mjchang@kwansei.ac.jp to get the Google Classroom site code to register.
*If the pandemic situation changes in March and we need to begin the semester online, students can check the Google Classroom site for teacher updated information and students will also be contacted individually by their KGU e-mail addresses to explain about online classes if on campus face-to-face classes are not possible in April.
**If classes are to be held online, all classes will be live using Zoom for synchronous style classes.
------
This is an all-English classroom. Students can expect to communicate with the teacher and other students in English only. Assignments may require the use of the computer and online sites.

Additionally, this class is taught communicatively and the class functions as a community in which all members support each other. This means that students can expect to interact regularly through pair work or small groups to review course content and/or will have consistent interaction with the teacher.

トピック.授業外学習2: This course builds on each previous lesson. Homework will be regularly assigned each week and is expected to be completed before the following class. The amount of study time required will vary from week to week depending on the subject/skill being reviewed. However, students can expect at least a minimum of 1 hour and a maximum of 2 hours of homework every week.
